Text: Guh...!
Shadow turns his sword to Zenon.

I thought you were going to hit me, Mr. Next-Gen
Rounds.
Nngh...!　That's enouuuugh!

Zenon howls as he executes a sweeping attack. His
forward thrusts are as piercing as a squall. His
consecutive strikes are as fierce as a raging fire.
But none of them land.
Aaaaaagghhhhh!

His ferocious roar sounds hollow. It's as if an adult
is practicing with a child.
Alexia watches the fight in shock.

She has never seen Zenon reveal this side of himself
before.

He has torn off his calm smile and mask of integrity,
and still, Shadow remains out of his reach.

The strongest person Alexia knows is her older
sister.

Even so, Alexia doesn't think her sister would be
capable of overwhelming Zenon.

The scant noise from their clashing blades echoes
through the area and seems almost out of place. It's
the exact sound of light practice.

The ebony blade and its white counterpart etch their
trajectories through the air. Alexia's gaze is fixed
on this imitation practice session.

She is mesmerized by the black sword. There's a
reason her eyes can't stray from it.
Mediocre swordplay...

The figure in front of Alexia fights the same way she
does.

When I was a child, I had my own ridiculous ideal of
swordplay...

I believed that even if I lacked my sister's talent,
I could become just as strong as her if I worked hard
enough.

But no matter how hard I tried, I never stood a
chance against a genius.

I've always been compared to my older sister and
mocked for being average.
The swordplay of someone without strength or talent.
Mediocre swordplay...
But despite all my struggles, I never gave up.

I never gave up on this swordplay I had foolishly
built up from the basics...
My...swordplay—
Oh—!
I like your swordplay, Alexia.

Alexia finally understands her sister's words from
long ago.
This is the swordplay Alexia likes.

Witnessing this, she can see the path the wielder has
walked in life. It's a direct result of serious and
unwavering efforts.
Alexia's sister might have the same thought.

And now, these unremarkable moves are overwhelming
the genius Zenon Griffey.
Gaghh!!!
Clutching his wound, Zenon falls to his knees.

He breathes raggedly as he glares at Shadow. His
enraged eyes still haven't accepted reality.

Y-You bastard! Show me who you are...! Why do you
hide your identity when you possess this much power?

Those with Shadow's strength hold riches and respect 
within arm's reach—with the potential to be known
worldwide.
But no one knows about Shadow's swordplay.

Even if he hides his face, those lucky enough to get
a glimpse of his swordplay will never forget it.

But this is the first time either Zenon or Alexia
have seen such phenomenal swordsmanship.

We are the Shadow Garden. We lurk in the darkness and
hunt down shadows.
That's the only reason we exist.
What—?! You're out of your mind...!
Zenon and Shadow exchange glances.
Shadow Garden... Cult... What is all this?

Alexia is completely excluded from this exchange. She
doesn't know why they're fighting or what they're
trying to accomplish.
Blood. Creature. Cult.
There are many key words to remember.

But Alexia doesn't know what they mean. To her, it
all sounds like the ravings of a madman.
But what if... What if it isn't just nonsense?

What if there is something going on behind the scenes
that Alexia doesn't know about?
Fine...

If you're ready to get serious, it looks like I'll
have to answer to your needs.
Zenon produces pills from his breast pocket.

With these pills, I shall be awakened and surpass all
human limitations.

An ordinary human would break under this power and
eventually self-destruct—
Zenon swallows the pills.
And then—
a violent storm of magic rages.

Zenon's wounds instantly begin healing. His muscles
tighten up, his eyes become bloodshot, and his
capillary vessels protrude. It looks as if he's being
crushed by a tremendous force.
I am the Third Awake.

Only those who can manipulate this devastating power 
have the privilege of joining the Rounds!
I'll show you...
...almighty power!
